title: Ivanka Trump returns to work following Misha Nonoo’s wedding in embellished Prada skirt
text:
Ivanka Trump attended the Global Call To Protect Religious Freedom conference during the 74th Session of the United Nations General Assembly [Photo: PA]

Ivanka Trump returned to work on Monday following a getaway to Rome for the star-studded wedding of fashion designer, Mischa Nonoo, and British businessman, Alexander Gilkes.

The nuptials had the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, Katy Perry, Orlando Bloom and Karlie Kloss in attendance and saw celebrities don their best evening wear - Ivanka dressing up in an ethereal peach hued caped gown by Israeli fashion designer, Gala Lahav.

For her back-to-work ensemble, the Advisor to the President wore a floral-adorned Prada skirt to the Concordia Annual Summit in New York.

The A-line midi skirt, from the Italian brand’s autumn 2019 collection, boasted bold yellow roses and is still available to purchase for £735.

Ivanka Trump at the United Nations Headquarters wearing a Prada skirt [Photo: PA] More

The 37-year-old paired the patterned skirt with a sky blue long-sleeved shirt and accessorised with gold hoop earrings and black patent heels.

READ MORE: Ivanka Trump shows off dramatic new cropped hairdo

Ivanka’s new short bob, which she first debuted in Columbia earlier in the month, was given its usual sleek poker straight finish.

Prada seems to be a popular choice in the Trump family currently, as Donald Trump’s wife, Melania Trump, wore a fitted black midi dress by the luxury label on the same day to visit the New York Stock Exchange.
